result.execSummary:
The defendant Amire T Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amire T Williams in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Court has found the State has satisfied victims' right law.

COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements made by Christopher W. and Marsha P.  

The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE AND FORTHWITH TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, with Huber release for school if defendant is in school, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following CONDITIONS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Court Ordered 30 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction, IMPOSED AND STAYED, STRAIGHT TIME, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharges during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
-Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/NO ALCOHOL or ILLEGAL DRUGS.
-No contact with victims, MAS and AMW.
-Obtain GED/HSED
-Sex Offender treatment.    
-No contact with firearms/weapons.
-Provide DNA sample.
-40 hours Community Service.

RESTITUTION set at Zero.

*Defense requested Expungement, DENIED by the Court.

The defendant is advised of his appeal rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Jury Instruction - filed with plea questionnaire
Signed and Filed. STIPULATION AND ORDER REGARDING USE OF VIDEOTAPED STATEMENTS
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Stipulation and Order Regarding use of Videotaped Statements

Defendant Amire T Williams in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  
Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared before Branch 15. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.S.,S.S.,I.B.,C.H.,C.O., I.S. and her parents.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amire T Williams in court with attorney Marcellus Parker.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 028681,
Payable Number: 994937,
Receipt Number: 22RP012051,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/22 @ 1:30p
